name: treatment of sewage sludge, 97% water, WWT, WW from GGBFS production, landfarming | organic nitrogen fertiliser, as N | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27030/documentation

The process represents the treatment of a waste (sewage sludge) that is exclusively produced from another waste treatment. Sewage sludge is generated in the wastewater treatment (WWT) of 'wastewater from GGBFS production'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used within the specific chain of treatments for 'wastewater from GGBFS production'. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 0%. "GGBFS" stands for "Ground granulated blast furnace slag".

The activity starts with the waste being available for landfarming. Collection and transportation of the waste to this process is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the landfarming process are released to the environment (air, water and soil). The activity is considering local fate of emissions and the initial specific wastewater composition (generating the sewage sludge). Further, it includes provision of fertiliser functions for N, P, K, if present in the sludge.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The site has mean annual temperature (MAT) of 11.074 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 941.82 mm/year, mean annual actual evaporation (EAT) of 332.479019640491 mm/year. Climate will influence the local fate emissions based on the elemental composition of the sludge as well as water evaporation to air (= consumptive water use).;NOAA, 2022. U.S. Climate Normals, National Centres for Environmental Information (NCEI) Available at: https://www.currentresults.com/Weather/US/average-annual-precipitation-by-city.php
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Landfarming is the process of spreading a substrate on agricultural soil. Sewage sludge is generated in the wastewater treatment of wastewater from GGBFS production. Spreading of liquid sewage sludge (97w% water content) on agricultural fields with mobile vacuum tanker.

exchanges.description: gross fertilizer function provided from sewage sludge spreading on agricultural fields.

flow.name: organic nitrogen fertiliser, as N
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production
